column4: im trying to install ubuntu but before the live disk boots i get a kernel panic error.. any ideas?
have you ran the disk for errors?
yuppers.. its not just that disk either any linux distro gets the kernel error when trying to install
do you have a raid configuration?
i dont believe so.. i think the error may be because i was trying to install freebsd earlier
so it hasn't happened before, just started?
yes after i tried to install freebsd
ok...sounds like you need to fdisk from a rescue cd before trying anything else, just wipe the hd clean
i believe it might be trying to mount or read the mbr and it's corrupted, so it's kernal panic'ing
which do u like better ultimate boot cd or trinity?
i tried the dang gparted live cd but that ot kernel errors too :(
just download fdisk onto a cd and run that to wipe the drive
if you can't seem to get the ultimate boot cd or trinity rescue disk to work
hehe thats what i was just about to say.. no luck with the disks :(
np...if you still can't get fdisk to work...gonna have to pull the hdd and slave it to a working system to wipe it
